title: Headsetâ€‹
content: </> VRCamera.Headset: Headset Reference to the headset that the camera is tracking.

title: Heightâ€‹
content: </> VRCamera.Height: number The vertical offset used to match the in-game floor to the real-life floor. This is not always the same as the height of the person.

title: WorldCFrameâ€‹
content: </> VRCamera.WorldCFrame: CFrame  The in-game rotation and floor position of the camera. This can be thought of as the location of the base of the camera.

title: WorldPositionâ€‹
content: </> VRCamera.WorldPosition: Vector3  The in-game floor position of the camera.

title: HeadCFrameâ€‹
content: unreleased </> VRCamera.HeadCFrame: CFrame  The in-game rotation and position of the headset. This isCFrame.new(0, VRCamera.Height, 0) * VRCamera.WorldCFrame * VRCamera.Headset.UserCFrame.

title: HeadPositionâ€‹
content: unreleased </> VRCamera.HeadPosition: Vector3  The in-game position of the headset.

title: Installationâ€‹
content: VRLib can be installed with Wally by adding it to the [dependencies] section of yourwally.toml file. [package] name = "your_name/your_project" version = "0.1.0" registry = "https://github.com/UpliftGames/wally-index" realm = "shared" [dependencies] VRLib = "raphtalia/vrlib@^1" Copy

title: Usageâ€‹
content: Below is an example of an extremely simple movement controller for the Quest 2. local ReplicatedStorage = game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage") local VRLib = require(ReplicatedStorage.Packages.VRLib) -- Wait for the VR devices to be ready (turn them on and connect them) VRLib.waitForUserCFrameAsync(Enum.UserCFrame.Head):expect() VRLib.waitForUserCFrameAsync(Enum.UserCFrame.LeftHand):expect() VRLib.waitForUserCFrameAsync(Enum.UserCFrame.RightHand):expect() -- Create the interfaces for the VR devices local leftController = VRLib.Controllers.Quest2.new(VRLib.Hand.Left) local rightController = VRLib.Controllers.Quest2.new(VRLib.Hand.Right) local headset = VRLib.Headset.new() -- Override Roblox's default VR camera local vrCamera = VRLib.VRCamera.new(headset) -- Create the lasers and make them invisible by default local leftLaser = VRLib.LaserPointer.new(leftController) leftLaser.Visible = false local rightLaser = VRLib.LaserPointer.new(rightController) rightLaser.Visible = false --[[ Holding down the index triggers on the controllers toggle a laser pointer that teleport the player to where the laser hits. ]] leftController.Inputs.IndexTrigger.FullyDown:Connect(function() leftLaser.Visible = true end) leftController.Inputs.IndexTrigger.Up:Connect(function() leftLaser.Visible = false if leftLaser.RaycastResult then vrCamera.WorldPosition = leftLaser.RaycastResult.Position end end) rightController.Inputs.IndexTrigger.FullyDown:Connect(function() rightLaser.Visible = true end) rightController.Inputs.IndexTrigger.Up:Connect(function() rightLaser.Visible = false if rightLaser.RaycastResult then vrCamera.WorldPosition = rightLaser.RaycastResult.Position end end) Copy

title: Controller Supportâ€‹
content: Headset support should work across the board while controller support is more difficult due to different input schemes and varying levels of support from Roblox themselves. âœ… - Fully supportedâš ï¸ - Partially supportedğŸ”œ - Not yet supportedâŒ - Will not be supported Controllers	Status	NotesOculus Touch	âœ… Valve Index	âš ï¸	Roblox maps the grip pressure sensors to buttons. HTC Vive	ğŸ”œ	Completely untested.

title: RawLocationâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.RawLocation: Vector2  The unprocessed location of the thumbstick. This means the location could have a negative magnitude or greater than 1.

title: Locationâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.Location: Vector2  Location is garunteed to have a magnitude of 0 when at rest and a magnitude of 1 when past the edge threshold.

title: EdgeThresholdâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.EdgeThreshold: number The threshold at which the thumbstick is considered to be at the edge.

title: IsDownâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.IsDown: boolean If the thumbstick is currently down.

title: IsEdgeâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.IsEdge: boolean If the thumbstick is at the edge.

title: Upâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.Up: Signal<> Fires when the thumbstick's is released as a button.

title: Downâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.Down: Signal<> Fires when the thumbstick's is pressed as a button.

title: Releasedâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.Released: Signal<> Fires when the thumbstick returns to center.

title: Changedâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.Changed: Signal<( loc:Â Vector2 , delta:Â Vector2 )> Fires when the thumbstick's location changes.

content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.EdgeEntered: Signal<> Fires when the thumbstick enters the edge.

content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Thumbstick.EdgeLeft: Signal<> Fires when the thumbstick leaves the edge.

title: RawPositionâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.RawPosition: number The unprocessed position of the trigger. This means the position could be negative or greater than 1.

title: Positionâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.Position: number Position is garunteed to be 0 when at rest and at 1 when past the threshold.

title: TriggerThresholdâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.TriggerThreshold: number The threshold at which the trigger is considered to be fully down.

title: IsDownâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.IsDown: boolean If the trigger is down at all.

title: IsFullyDownâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.IsFullyDown: boolean If the trigger is fully down.

title: Upâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.Up: Signal<> Fires when the trigger is released from the fully down position.

title: Downâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.Down: Signal<> Fires when the trigger is initially pressed.

title: FullyUpâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.FullyUp: Signal<> Fires when the trigger is released fully.

title: FullyDownâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.FullyDown: Signal<> Fires when the trigger is fully pressed.

title: Changedâ€‹
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Trigger.Changed: Signal<( pos:Â number, delta:Â number )> Fires when the trigger's position changes.
